abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Fourth and Fifth Poverty
            Reduction Support Credit Projects for Senegal were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory, risk to
            development outcome was substantial, Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and Borrower performance was
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            Budget support can be an effective tool to mobilize the
            ministry of finance on sectoral reform, under the right
            circumstances. Policy-based lending under a harmonized
            approach among donors can be an effective tool to strengthen
            the country-based development model. Ministries and agencies
            participating in budget support operations have a tendency
            to focus on the realization of prior actions, so systematic
            follow-up actions are needed. More attention to political
            economy considerations may be needed to better understand
            opposition to reform, particularly in sensitive areas.
